Summary: The iPhone 16 Pro Max adds more screen real estate and offers one of the best battery life we have ever recorded in an iPhone. The new Camera Control is a fun addition and makes using the camera handy. Apple Intelligence features look promising, though some wait for that as it is not here. Cameras are a big step up, and it offers a stunning display. If you're still using the iPhone 14 Pro Max or older models, then the 16 Pro Max makes total sense.
Colours: Black Titanium, Natural Titanium, White Titanium, Desert Titanium

Summary: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6 is a refined foldable smartphone that promises top-notch everyday performance. Samsung has improved the crease, and the display experience is fantastic. The software is polished and offers a great experience. The tons of AI features are handy and can come to your rescue for boring stuff like transcribing and summarising meetings into simple bullet points. The cameras are capable, and the battery easily lasts a day. The only big problem here is the pricing. Overall, the Fold 6 is one of the most refined foldable phones in the market right now.
Colours: Silver Shadow, Pink, Navy, Crafted Black, White

Summary:
Google’s Pixel 9 Pro Fold has a very slim design for a foldable both when closed and open. It has flat sides with a metal frame and rear and front panels made of glass. The design is IP rated but only for water.
Performance is just fine. But software seems to be optimised for battery savings and so is not a buttery smooth experience. Google 7 years of software and security updates along with the phone’s numerous AI features sweeten the deal. The phone comes with several image editing and image generation features which work well.
Camera performance is a bit below average given the phone’s price. The same applies to video recording which is also quite poor.
Battery life is a bit below average considering that the competition manages better. The same applies to wired and wireless charging speeds which are quite slow.

Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra mobile was launched on 17th January 2024. The phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate 6.80-inch touchscreen display (QHD+). The display sports Gorilla Glass Armor for protection. Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is powered by  an octa-core Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor. It comes with 12GB of RAM. The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 5000mAh non-removable battery.  The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra supports wireless charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra on the rear packs a quad camera setup featuring a 200-megapixel (f/1.8) primary  camera;  a 12-megapixel (f/2.2, ultra wide-angle)  camera;  a 50-megapixel (f/3.4, telephoto)  camera, and  a 10-megapixel (f/2.4)  camera. The rear camera setup has multi directional pdaf. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 12-megapixel sensor with an f/2.2 aperture.The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra runs One UI 6.1 is based on Android 14 and packs 256GB, 512GB, 1TB of inbuilt storage. The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra is a dual-SIM (GSM and GSM) mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and Nano-SIM cards. The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra measures 162.30 x 79.00 x 8.60mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 232.00 grams. It was launched in Titanium Gray, Titanium Black, and  Titanium Violet colours. It features an IP68 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra include Wi-Fi  802.11 a/b/g/n/ac/ax, GPS, Bluetooth v5.30, NFC, USB Type-C, Wi-Fi Direct, 3G, 4G (with support for Band 40 used by some LTE networks in India) , and  5G with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  barometer,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  in-display fingerprint sensor,  proximity sensor, and  fingerprint sensor. Brand exclusive features include Titanium frame, Corning Gorilla Armor (Rear and Front Panel).As of 22nd January 2025, Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra price in India starts at Rs. 99,999.
Colours: Titanium Gray, Titanium Black, Titanium Violet

Summary:
Google’s Pixel 9 Pro XL has a premium design made from glass and aluminium with well-rounded corners. It’s also IP68 rated for dust and water resistance and manages to pack a vapour chamber cooling system and wireless charging coil despite its slim appearance.
It has a flat display which gets really bright and can tackle direct sunlight well all while showcasing natural-looking colours. The software experience is top notch and the AI features are very capable and also useful depending on what you want to use.
Overall performance is quite solid for daily use and also for gaming. Camera quality is very impressive and the Video Boost feature sure works wonders to improve video recordings.
The Pixel 9 Pro XL comes with nearly the same battery capacity as its predecessor and so will remain a one-day smartphone for power users. Charging speeds have improved provided you can get your hands on Google’s proprietary charger.

iPhone 16 Pro mobile was launched on 9th September 2024. The phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate 6.30-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  1206x2622 pixels at a pixel density of 460 pixels per inch (ppi). iPhone 16 Pro is powered by  a hexa-core Apple A18 Pro processor. It comes with 8GB of RAM. The iPhone 16 Pro supports wireless charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the iPhone 16 Pro on the rear packs a triple camera setup featuring a 48-megapixel (f/1.78) primary  camera;  a 12-megapixel (f/2.8, telephoto)  camera, and  a 48-megapixel (f/2.2, ultra wide-angle)  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 12-megapixel sensor with an f/1.9 aperture.iPhone 16 Pro is based on iOS 18 and packs 128GB, 256GB, 512GB, 1TB of inbuilt storage. The iPhone 16 Pro is a dual-SIM (GSM and GSM) mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and eSIM cards. The iPhone 16 Pro measures 149.60 x 71.50 x 8.25mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 199.00 grams. It was launched in Black Titanium, Natural Titanium, White Titanium, and  Desert Titanium colours. It features an IP68 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the iPhone 16 Pro include Wi-Fi 7, Wi-Fi  802.11 b/g/n/ac/ax, GPS, Bluetooth v5.30, NFC, USB Type-C, 3G, 4G (with support for Band 40 used by some LTE networks in India) , and  5G with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  barometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  compass/ magnetometer.As of 22nd January 2025, iPhone 16 Pro price in India starts at Rs. 112,900.
Colours: Black Titanium, Natural Titanium, White Titanium, Desert Titanium

Summary: The Pixel 9 Pro ticks most checkboxes for a compact flagship smartphone. It packs a solid build and an excellent display. The performance is decent for everyday tasks until you are more inclined towards gaming. On the camera front, the 9 Pro outshines some expensive rivals. There are tons of AI features, and it also comes with Google's 7 years of software support. All of these features make the Pixel 9 Pro an excellent premium device.

Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6 is an incremental upgrade over the Flip 5 from last year. Samsung, however, is bullish about its entire AI push and works in favour of the Flip 6. There are plenty of features you can use daily that are not at all gimmicky. Specs-wise, there are improvements to the camera and battery front. The display is now brighter than its predecessor. Overall, the Galaxy Z Flip 6 delivers what it promises but at a premium price.
Colours: Silver Shadow, Yellow, Blue, Mint, Crafted Black, White, Peach

Summary:
The Oppo Find X8 Pro goes with the typical Oppo design language consisting of curved sides and rounded corners. It sticks with metal and glass but goes with 3d-curved screens offering a quad-curved panel for its display.
While the quad-curved display looks attractive, it’s not the best outdoors as it produces one too many reflections which can get distracting.
Oppo has included top-notch camera hardware but sadly hasn’t optimised it well, resulting in images that aren’t really best in class. Contrary to its camera capabilities, we were impressed by its video recordings.
Battery life thanks to its new energy-dense battery technology is stellar. The same applies for charging speeds which are class-leading both for wired and wireless charging.
Software is a bit of a mixed bag. Oppo has added plenty of customisation options especially for its lockscreen, but fumbles a bit when it comes to AI features.

Vivo X200 Pro is an all-rounder with outstanding cameras. If you're a camera enthusiast, your search should end with this phone, as it offers a better camera setup than most phones in this price segment. In terms of performance, the phone delivers flagship-grade prowess with no complaints. The battery performance is class-leading, too, with no match in the entire premium Android smartphone range.
Colours: Carbon Black, Titanium Grey, Moonlight White, Sapphire Blue

Summary:
The OnePlus 13 has a brand-new design that’s now available in a vegan leather option as well. Accompanying the new design are new cases with magnets in place to hold the new wireless charging accessories. The phone is both IP68 and IP69 certified for dust and water resistance.
OnePlus has a new quad-curved screen for its mostly flat display, which is a departure from the curved edge displays on previous models. The phone runs OxygenOS 15, which is based on Android 15 and comes with many new and useful AI-enabled features.
The phone offers plenty of raw performance for regular use and demanding tasks like gaming and camera usage thanks to its new 3nm processor. The camera performance is unparalleled at this price point, and the same holds true for video recording.
The high-capacity battery life easily lasts beyond a day of casual use and also charges up faster than most premium devices using both wired and wireless sources.
Colours: Arctic Dawn, Black Eclipse, Midnight Ocean

Summary: The iPhone 16 Plus is for those who want the latest iPhone under a lakh but do not want a smaller screen and compromise on the battery front. The 16 Plus should appeal to heavy multimedia users who love to be on their phones while on the go. The battery performance is amazing, and this one can handle anything and everything thrown at it during everyday use. The cameras are solid and overall, the 16 Plus is the iPhone to consider this year under a lakh, which can offer pro features without actually buying one.

iPhone 16 mobile was launched on 9th September 2024. The phone comes with a 60 Hz refresh rate 6.10-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  1179x2556 pixels at a pixel density of 460 pixels per inch (ppi). iPhone 16 is powered by  a hexa-core Apple A18 processor. It comes with 8GB of RAM. The iPhone 16 supports wireless charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the iPhone 16 on the rear packs a dual camera setup featuring a 48-megapixel (f/1.6) primary  camera, and  a 12-megapixel (f/2.2, ultra wide-angle)  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 12-megapixel sensor with an f/1.9 aperture.iPhone 16 is based on iOS 18 and packs 128GB, 256GB, 512GB of inbuilt storage. The iPhone 16 is a dual-SIM (GSM and GSM) mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and Nano-SIM cards. The iPhone 16 measures 147.60 x 71.60 x 7.80mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 170.00 grams. It was launched in Black, White, Pink, Teal, and  Ultramarine colours. It features an IP68 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the iPhone 16 include Wi-Fi  802.11 b/g/n/ac/ax, GPS, Bluetooth v5.30, NFC, USB Type-C, 3G, 4G (with support for Band 40 used by some LTE networks in India) , and  5G with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  barometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  compass/ magnetometer.As of 22nd January 2025, iPhone 16 price in India starts at Rs. 74,900.

Samsung Galaxy S24 mobile was launched on 17th January 2024. The phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate 6.20-inch touchscreen display (FHD+). The display sports Gorilla Glass for protection. Samsung Galaxy S24 is powered by  an octa-core processor. It comes with 8GB of RAM. The Samsung Galaxy S24 runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 4000mAh non-removable battery.  The Samsung Galaxy S24 supports wireless charging, as well as proprietary fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Samsung Galaxy S24 on the rear packs a 50-megapixel (f/1.8) primary  camera;  a 12-megapixel (f/2.2)  camera, and  a 10-megapixel (f/2.4)  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 12-megapixel sensor.The Samsung Galaxy S24 runs One UI 6.1 is based on Android 14 and packs 128GB, 256GB, 512GB of inbuilt storage. The Samsung Galaxy S24 is a dual-SIM (GSM and GSM) mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and Nano-SIM cards. The Samsung Galaxy S24 measures 147.00 x 70.60 x 7.60mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 168.00 grams. It was launched in Amber Yellow, Cobalt Violet, Marble Gray, and  Onyx Black colours. It features an IP68 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the Samsung Galaxy S24 include Wi-Fi  802.11 ax, GPS, Bluetooth v5.30, NFC, USB Type-C, Wi-Fi Direct, 3G, 4G (with support for Band 40 used by some LTE networks in India) , and  5G with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  barometer,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  in-display fingerprint sensor,  proximity sensor, and  fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, Samsung Galaxy S24 price in India starts at Rs. 50,580.
Colours: Amber Yellow, Cobalt Violet, Marble Gray, Onyx Black

Summary:
The Realme GT 7 Pro has an IP69-rated design that is made of metal and glass. Both the front and rear glass panels have 3D-curved edges on all four sides, making it comfortable to hold given its large footprint.
The phone processor offers more than enough raw performance for casual use and can handle any game you can throw at it without breaking sweat. The software experience is buttery smooth and has been updated to the latest version of Android.
Camera performance is good for its price tag, but this performance is mainly limited to its primary and telephoto cameras. The ultrawide camera is subpar, and the video recording quality is average for a smartphone in this price bracket.
Battery life, given the battery’s massive capacity, easily lasts two days with regular use. Charging speed is speedy even for a flagship device. However, this phone lacks wireless charging.

Vivo X200 mobile was launched on 14th October 2024. The phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate 6.67-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  2800x1260 pixels and an aspect ratio of 20:9. Vivo X200 is powered by  a 3.6 MHz octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 9400 processor that features 1 core clocked at 3.626 MHz, 3 cores clocked at 3.3 MHz and  4 cores clocked at 2.4 MHz. It comes with 12GB, 16GB of RAM. The Vivo X200 runs Android 15 and  is powered by a 5800mAh non-removable battery.  The Vivo X200 supports 90W Fast Charging fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Vivo X200 on the rear packs a triple camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel (f/1.57) primary  camera;  a 50-megapixel (f/2.57, telephoto)  camera, and  a 50-megapixel (f/2.0, ultra wide-angle)  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 32-megapixel sensor with an f/2.0 aperture.The Vivo X200 runs Origin OS 5 is based on Android 15 and packs 256GB, 512GB of inbuilt storage. The Vivo X200 is a dual-SIM mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and eSIM cards. The Vivo X200 measures 160.27 x 74.81 x 7.99mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 197.00 grams. It was launched in Carbon Black, Titanium Grey, Moonlight White, and  Sapphire Blue colours. It features an IP69 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the Vivo X200 include Wi-Fi 7, Wi-Fi,  Bluetooth v5.40, USB Type-C, 4G , and  5G. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor,  temperature sensor, and  fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, Vivo X200 price in India starts at Rs. 56,990.
Colours: Carbon Black, Titanium Grey, Moonlight White, Sapphire Blue

Summary: OnePlus 13R mobile was launched on 7th January 2025. The phone comes with a 6.78-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  2780x1264 pixels (1.5K) at a pixel density of 450 pixels per inch (ppi). OnePlus 13R is powered by  an octa-core Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor. It comes with 12GB, 16GB of RAM. The OnePlus 13R runs Android 15 and  is powered by a 6000mAh battery.  The OnePlus 13R supports 80W Fast Charging fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the OnePlus 13R on the rear packs a triple camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel (f/1.8) primary  camera;  a 50-megapixel (f/2.0, ultra wide-angle)  camera, and  an 8-megapixel (f/2.2, macro)  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 16-megapixel sensor with an f/2.4 aperture.The OnePlus 13R runs OxygenOS 15.0 is based on Android 15 and packs 256GB, 512GB of inbuilt storage. The OnePlus 13R is a dual-SIM mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and Nano-SIM cards. The OnePlus 13R measures 161.72 x 75.77 x 8.02mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 207.00 grams. It was launched in Astral Trail and  Nebula Noir colours. It features an IP65 rating for dust and water protection. It bears a metal body.  Connectivity options on the OnePlus 13R include Wi-Fi 7, Wi-Fi  802.11 a/b/g/n, GPS, Bluetooth v5.40, NFC, USB Type-C, 3G, 4G , and  5G with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor,  temperature sensor, and  in-display fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, OnePlus 13R price in India starts at Rs. 42,969.

Motorola Edge 50 Ultra mobile was launched on 18th June 2024. The phone comes with a 144 Hz refresh rate 6.70-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  1220x2712 pixels (1.5K) at a pixel density of 446 pixels per inch (ppi) and an aspect ratio of 20:9. The display sports Gorilla Glass Victus for protection. Motorola Edge 50 Ultra is powered by  an octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 processor. It comes with 12GB of RAM. The Motorola Edge 50 Ultra runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 4500mAh non-removable battery.  The Motorola Edge 50 Ultra supports wireless charging, as well as 125W Fast Charging fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Motorola Edge 50 Ultra on the rear packs a triple camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel primary  camera;  a 50-megapixel  camera, and  a 64-megapixel  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 50-megapixel sensor.The Motorola Edge 50 Ultra runs Hello UI is based on Android 14 and packs 512GB of inbuilt storage. The Motorola Edge 50 Ultra is a dual-SIM mobile. The Motorola Edge 50 Ultra measures 161.09 x 72.38 x 8.59mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 197.00 grams. It was launched in Forest Grey, Nordic Wood, and  Peach Fuzz colours. It features an IP68 rating for dust and water protection. It bears a wood body.  Connectivity options on the Motorola Edge 50 Ultra include Wi-Fi  802.11 a/b/g/n/ax, GPS, Bluetooth v5.40, NFC, and  USB Type-C. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  barometer,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  in-display fingerprint sensor. The Motorola Edge 50 Ultra supports     face unlock.As of 22nd January 2025, Motorola Edge 50 Ultra price in India starts at Rs. 48,700.
Colours: Forest Grey, Nordic Wood, Peach Fuzz

Summary:
The Pixel 8a has a fresh new design that will remind many of the premium offerings in Google’s smartphone lineup. Its design still uses a plastic back but now has a more premium feel thanks to its soft, frosted finish.

The phone also offers a solid IP67 rating for dust and water resistance. Its Tensor G3 brings plenty of new AI features once reserved for the premium Pixels to the A series. Performance is still not its strong point, but it offers decent performance for everyday app usage.

Still, the camera performance is pretty solid, and the same can be said about the rear camera’s low-light performance, which works well on both primary and ultrawide cameras.

Battery life is not great but will last most users a day. Charging speeds are still quite slow and the same applies to the Qi standard wireless charging the phone offers.

The Nothing Phone 2a Plus is carved out from the skin as Nothing Phone 2a. The device offers the same Glyph interface, which is interesting to use and offers a transparent back panel for a unique design element. The handset also has an updated processor that performs well at this price segment. The Nothing Phone 2a Plus also brings a clean user interface that definitely stands out from the rest of the competition. The camera capabilities are good, and you also get some good battery life. That said, the cameras offer better performance as compared to the Nothing Phone 2a, but it still needs some improvements. So, if you are looking for a mid-range Nothing phone with some improvements, you can consider Nothing Phone 2a Plus.

The OnePlus Nord CE4 has an IP54 rating for dust and water resistance. It has a frame made out of polycarbonate that is supposed to be very durable and is able to sustain drops. The rear panel too is made of polycarbonate.
The phone offers good performance for the casual user, but is not ideal for gaming. Its display can get really bright outdoors and is also HDR10-certified. While it offers a high refresh rate, its touch sampling rate or sensitivity comes up a bit short while playing FPS games
The Nord CE4 comes with OxygenOS 14, which is based on Android 14. It is highly customisable and offers some handy new features like Fluid Cloud. Some of these features are AI-enabled.
Overall camera performance is quite average for its segment and video recording quality isn’t great either. Battery life is excellent and the phone offers fast wired charging.

The Realme GT 6T is the first T-branded smartphone from Realme. It has a plastic back and a polycarbonate frame, but manages an IP65 rating for dust and water resistance. However, it is a proper smudge and dust magnet.
Performance is handled by a capable mid-range processor which offers enough power for both daily use and high-end gaming. The capable software also helps balance out battery life and also gets some AI-enabled features.
Camera performance is decent for its price tag. The phone struggles a bit in low light and we weren’t impressed by the ultra-wide camera, which produced passable results in daylight. The Realme GT 6T’s video recording capabilities are far from impressive.
Its dual-cell battery easily lasts over a day and can be used for two days with casual (non-gaming) usage thanks to its large capacity. Wired charging is very fast as well.

Poco X6 Pro mobile was launched on 11th January 2024. The phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate 6.67-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  1220x2712 pixels. It comes with 8GB, 12GB of RAM. The Poco X6 Pro runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 5000mAh non-removable battery.  The Poco X6 Pro supports proprietary fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Poco X6 Pro on the rear packs a triple camera setup featuring a 64-megapixel primary  camera;  an 8-megapixel (ultra wide-angle)  camera, and  a 2-megapixel (macro)  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 16-megapixel sensor.The Poco X6 Pro runs HyperOS is based on Android 14 and packs 256GB, 512GB of inbuilt storage that can be expanded via microSD card. The Poco X6 Pro is a dual-SIM (GSM and GSM) mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and Nano-SIM cards. It was launched in Poco Yellow, Racing Grey, and  and Spectre Black colours. It features an IP54 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the Poco X6 Pro include Wi-Fi  802.11 b/g/n/ac, GPS, NFC, USB Type-C, 3G, 4G (with support for Band 40 used by some LTE networks in India) , and  5G with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  in-display fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, Poco X6 Pro price in India starts at Rs. 24,849.
Colours: Poco Yellow, Racing Grey, and Spectre Black

Summary: OnePlus Nord 4 mobile was launched on 16th July 2024. The phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate 6.74-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  1240x2772 pixels (FHD+) at a pixel density of 450 pixels per inch (ppi). OnePlus Nord 4 is powered by  an octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 7+ Gen 3 processor. It comes with 8GB, 12GB of RAM. The OnePlus Nord 4 runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 5500mAh non-removable battery.  The OnePlus Nord 4 supports 100W Fast Charging fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the OnePlus Nord 4 on the rear packs a triple camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel primary  camera, and  an 8-megapixel (ultra wide-angle)  camera. The rear camera setup has autofocus. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 16-megapixel sensor.The OnePlus Nord 4 runs OxygenOS 14.1 is based on Android 14 and packs 128GB, 256GB of inbuilt storage. The OnePlus Nord 4 is a dual-SIM (GSM and GSM) mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and Nano-SIM cards. The OnePlus Nord 4 measures 162.60 x 75.00 x 8.00mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 199.50 grams. It was launched in Mercurial Silver, Oasis Green, and  and Obsidian Midnight colours. It features an IP54 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the OnePlus Nord 4 include Wi-Fi,  GPS, Bluetooth v5.40, NFC, Infrared, USB Type-C, 3G, 4G (with support for Band 40 used by some LTE networks in India) , and  5G with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  in-display fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, OnePlus Nord 4 price in India starts at Rs. 27,804.
Colours: Mercurial Silver, Oasis Green, and Obsidian Midnight

Summary: Motorola's Edge 50 Pro is equipped with a Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 processor, a 50-megapixel triple rear camera setup, and a 4,500mAh battery with up to 125W fast charging support. The phone offers some world first features such as a Pantone validated display and cameras. The Edge 50 Pro has a premium design and is available in three colour options. It is offered with up to 12GB RAM and 256GB internal storage. You also get an IP68 dust and water resistance rating. The phone has a 6.7-inch pOLED curved display with 1.5K resolution, 144Hz refresh rate, and a peak brightness of 2,000 nits. It has a stereo speaker setup with Dolby Atmos support, 3 microphones, and an in-display fingerprint scanner.
Colours: Black Beauty, Luxe Lavender, Moonlight Pearl

Summary: Poco F6 5G mobile was launched on 23rd May 2024. The phone comes with a 6.67-inch display offering a resolution of  1220x2712 pixels. The display sports Gorilla Glass for protection. The Poco F6 5G runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 5000mAh battery.  The Poco F6 5G supports 90W Fast Charging fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Poco F6 5G on the rear packs a dual camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel primary  camera, and  an 8-megapixel  camera. It sports a 20-megapixel camera on the front for selfies.The Poco F6 5G runs HyperOS is based on Android 14. The Poco F6 5G measures 160.00 x 74.40 x 7.80mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 179.00 grams. It was launched in Black and  Titanium colours. It features an IP64 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the Poco F6 5G include Wi-Fi  802.11 a/b/g/n/ac. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  in-display fingerprint sensor. The Poco F6 5G supports     face unlock.As of 22nd January 2025, Poco F6 5G price in India starts at Rs. 24,999.

Vivo T3 Pro 5G mobile was launched on 27th August 2024. The phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate 6.77-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  1080x2392 pixels (FHD+). It comes with 8GB of RAM. The Vivo T3 Pro 5G runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 5500mAh non-removable battery.  The Vivo T3 Pro 5G supports 80W Fast Charging fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Vivo T3 Pro 5G on the rear packs a dual camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel primary  camera, and  an 8-megapixel  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 16-megapixel sensor.The Vivo T3 Pro 5G runs Funtouch OS 14 is based on Android 14 and packs 128GB, 256GB of inbuilt storage. The Vivo T3 Pro 5G is a dual-SIM mobile. The Vivo T3 Pro 5G measures 163.72 x 75.00 x 7.49mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 184.00 grams. It was launched in Emerald Green and  Sandstone Orange colours. It features an IP64 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the Vivo T3 Pro 5G include Wi-Fi,  GPS, Bluetooth v5.40, and  USB Type-C with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  in-display fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, Vivo T3 Pro 5G price in India starts at Rs. 22,999.

Nothing Phone 2a mobile was launched on 5th March 2024. The phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate 6.70-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  1080x2412 pixels (FHD+) at a pixel density of 394 pixels per inch (ppi). It comes with 8GB, 12GB of RAM. The Nothing Phone 2a runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 5000mAh battery.  The Nothing Phone 2a supports proprietary fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Nothing Phone 2a on the rear packs a dual camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel primary  camera, and  a 50-megapixel  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 32-megapixel sensor.The Nothing Phone 2a runs Nothing OS 2.5 is based on Android 14 and packs 128GB, 256GB of inbuilt storage. The Nothing Phone 2a measures 161.74 x 76.00 x 8.55mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 190.00 grams. It was launched in Black and  White colours. Connectivity options on the Nothing Phone 2a include Wi-Fi  802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, GPS, and  USB Type-C with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  fingerprint sensor. The Nothing Phone 2a supports     face unlock.As of 22nd January 2025, Nothing Phone 2a price in India starts at Rs. 20,699.

The Realme 12 Pro+ offers a vegan-leather design for its rear panel and also has a very watch-like fluted metal ring around its revamped cameras. The phone isn’t just about a fancy design, but also packs in a solid IP65 rating for dust and water resistance.
Its processor offers more than enough capability to handle day to day tasks and multitasking, but also offers decent gaming performance. The phone also offers the latest Android 14 software but comes loaded with bloatware, which thankfully isn’t intrusive and does not affect the software experience.
Apart from its design, the phone’s biggest highlight are its cameras. While the primary camera performs well in all types of lighting conditions, the telephoto camera is the showstopper, offering excellent capability at native focal lengths in all types of lighting conditions.
Battery life is top notch and the phone easily lasts a day and half with regular use. Charging speeds are also relatively good.
Colours: Navigator Beige, Submarine Blue, Explorer Red

Summary:
The Samsung Galaxy F55 5G features a sleek vegan leather finish that stands out from the crowd. The display also delivers good results with deep blacks and good viewing angles.  
On the performance front, the handset delivers almost all the tasks that you throw at it whether it be gaming or scrolling your Instagram feed. The major upgrade has to be the 45W fast charging support that allows it to be fully charged in one hour. The interface is user-friendly and offers some interesting set of customisations. The in-display fingerprint sensor works fast and the Always-On Display is a cherry on top.
The cameras are decent, though the low-light performance could have been better. That said, if you are looking for a stylish mid-ranger that offers a decent mix of performance and premium design, then the smartphone sure seems to be an interesting choice.

Poco X7 Pro is the all-new mid-range smartphone that's priced under Rs. 30,000. This is the first phone to debut with MediaTek 8400 Ultra processor and packs the largest battery at this price. Poco's new X7 Pro is also the company's first with HyperOS 2.0, based on Android 15. The dual camera setup is decent, and the phone weighs under 200 grams. At its price, the X7 Pro is a great value proposition and is a perfect choice for anyone eyeing anything around this price segment.
Colours: Nebula Green, Obsidian Black, Poco Yellow

The OnePlus Nord CE 4 Lite 5G measures 162.90 x 75.60 x 8.10mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 191.00 grams. It was launched in Mega Blue, Super Silver, and  Ultra Orange colours. Sensors on the  phone include in-display fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, OnePlus Nord CE 4 Lite 5G price in India starts at Rs. 17,490.

Colours: Midnight Black, Phantom Blue, Star White

The phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate 6.67-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  2400x1080 pixels (FHD+). Realme Narzo 70 Turbo 5G is powered by  an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 7300 Energy 5G processor. It comes with 6GB, 8GB, 12GB of RAM. The Realme Narzo 70 Turbo 5G runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 5000mAh battery.  The Realme Narzo 70 Turbo 5G supports 45W Fast Charging fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Realme Narzo 70 Turbo 5G on the rear packs a dual camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel primary  camera, and  a 2-megapixel  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 16-megapixel sensor.The Realme Narzo 70 Turbo 5G runs Realme UI 5.1 is based on Android 14 and packs 128GB, 256GB of inbuilt storage. The Realme Narzo 70 Turbo 5G is a dual-SIM mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and Nano-SIM cards. Connectivity options on the Realme Narzo 70 Turbo 5G include Wi-Fi,  GPS, Bluetooth v5.40, USB Type-C, 3G, 4G (with support for Band 40 used by some LTE networks in India) , and  5G with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor,  temperature sensor, and  in-display fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, Realme Narzo 70 Turbo 5G price in India starts at Rs. 15,235.
Colours: Turbo Yellow, Turbo Green and Turbo Purple

Summary: Motorola Edge 50 Neo mobile was launched on 29th August 2024. The phone comes with a 120 Hz refresh rate 6.40-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  1220x2670 pixels (FHD+) at a pixel density of 460 pixels per inch (ppi) and an aspect ratio of 20:9. The display sports Corning Gorilla Glass 3 for protection. Motorola Edge 50 Neo is powered by  an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 7300 processor. It comes with 12GB of RAM. The Motorola Edge 50 Neo runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 5000mAh non-removable battery.  The Motorola Edge 50 Neo supports wireless charging, as well as 68W Turbo Charge fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Motorola Edge 50 Neo on the rear packs a triple camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel (f/1.8) primary  camera;  a 13-megapixel (f/2.2, ultra wide-angle)  camera, and  a 10-megapixel (f/2.0, telephoto)  camera. The rear camera setup has autofocus. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 32-megapixel sensor with an f/2.4 aperture. The front camera also features autofocus.The Motorola Edge 50 Neo runs Hello UI is based on Android 14 and packs 256GB of inbuilt storage (up to 1000GB). The Motorola Edge 50 Neo is a dual-SIM (GSM and GSM) mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and Nano-SIM cards. The Motorola Edge 50 Neo measures 154.10 x 71.20 x 8.10mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 171.00 grams. It was launched in Pantone Grisaille, Pantone Latte, Pantone Nautical Blue, and  Pantone Poinciana colours. It features an IP68 rating for dust and water protection. It bears a pu leather body.  Connectivity options on the Motorola Edge 50 Neo include Wi-Fi  802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, GPS, Bluetooth v5.30, NFC, USB Type-C, 3G, 4G (with support for Band 40 used by some LTE networks in India) , and  5G with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  in-display fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, Motorola Edge 50 Neo price in India starts at Rs. 20,999.
Colours: Pantone Grisaille, Pantone Latte, Pantone Nautical Blue, Pantone Poinciana

Summary: The CMF Phone 1 has interesting features and specifications that make it stand out. The swappable rear panels are a unique thing that you will find in this price segment nowadays. The phone also has an IP65 rating, good enough for minor spills. The handset also delivers decent performance in this price segment. The gaming is handled reasonably, and so does everyday tasks. Moreover, the phone brings a custom user interface that gives a unique look and feel. The phone also brings good camera performance in different lighting conditions. However, there is no support for a wide-angle lens or telephoto lens. The battery life is solid for this one, and the charging speed is good enough.

The Moto G64 5G is a minor update over last year's Moto G54 5G. It comes with a slightly faster MediaTek Dimensity 7025 SoC, which is paired with up to 12GB RAM and 256GB internal storage. The phone is fast enough for most tasks and you can also play most games on it without any heating issues or lag. However, you'll need to run high-end games on lower settings. You get a dual rear camera setup with a main 50-megapixel sensor with OIS, and an 8-megapixel ultra-wide sensor. Photo quality is good in daylight conditions, but lowlight performance isn't that good. The phone also packs a 6,000mAh battery that can easily last two days with normal usage. A 33W fast charger is available in the box. The Moto G64 5G, while it doesn't offer major upgrades over its predecessor, is still good value for money and easy to recommend.

iPhone 15 mobile was launched on 12th September 2023. The phone comes with a 60 Hz refresh rate 6.10-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  1179x2556 pixels at a pixel density of 460 pixels per inch (ppi). iPhone 15 is powered by  a hexa-core Apple A16 Bionic processor. It comes with 6GB of RAM. The iPhone 15 supports wireless charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the iPhone 15 on the rear packs a dual camera setup featuring a 48-megapixel (f/1.6) primary  camera, and  a 12-megapixel (f/2.4)  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 12-megapixel sensor with an f/1.9 aperture.iPhone 15 is based on iOS 17 and packs 128GB, 256GB, 512GB of inbuilt storage. The iPhone 15 is a dual-SIM (GSM and GSM) mobile that accepts Nano-SIM and Nano-SIM cards. The iPhone 15 measures 147.60 x 71.60 x 7.80mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 171.00 grams. It was launched in Black, Blue, Green, Pink, and  Yellow colours. It features an IP68 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the iPhone 15 include Wi-Fi  802.11 b/g/n/ac/ax, GPS, Bluetooth v5.30, NFC, USB Type-C, 3G, 4G (with support for Band 40 used by some LTE networks in India) , and  5G with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  barometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  compass/ magnetometer.As of 22nd January 2025, iPhone 15 price in India starts at Rs. 58,999.

The Poco M7 Pro 5G is a dual-SIM mobile. The Poco M7 Pro 5G measures 162.40 x 75.70 x 7.99mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 190.00 grams. It was launched in Lavender Frost, Lunar Dust, and  Olive Twilight colours. It features an IP64 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the Poco M7 Pro 5G include Wi-Fi  802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, GPS, Bluetooth v5.30, Infrared, and  USB Type-C with active 4G on both SIM cards. Colours: Lavender Frost, Lunar Dust, Olive Twilight

Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  fingerprint sensor. Summary: Samsung Galaxy M15 5G Prime Edition mobile was launched on 25th September 2024. Connectivity options on the Samsung Galaxy M15 5G Prime Edition include Wi-Fi,  GPS, Bluetooth v5.30, and  USB Type-C with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, Samsung Galaxy M15 5G Prime Edition price in India starts at Rs. 11,999.
Colours: Blue Topaz, Celestial Blue, Stone Grey

Google Pixel 9 mobile was launched on 13th August 2024. The Google Pixel 9 runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 4700mAh non-removable battery.  The Google Pixel 9 supports wireless charging, as well as 45W Fast Charging fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Google Pixel 9 on the rear packs a dual camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel primary  camera, and  a 48-megapixel  camera. The rear camera setup has autofocus. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 10.5-megapixel sensor.Google Pixel 9 is based on Android 14 and packs 256GB of inbuilt storage. The Google Pixel 9 measures 152.80 x 72.00 x 8.50mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 198.00 grams. It was launched in Peony, Porcelain, Obsidian, and  Wintergreen colours. It features an IP68 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the Google Pixel 9 include Wi-Fi  802.11 a/b/g/n/ac/ax, GPS, Bluetooth v5.30, NFC, and  USB Type-C with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  barometer,  compass/ magnetometer,  gyroscope,  proximity sensor, and  in-display fingerprint sensor. The Google Pixel 9 supports     face unlock.As of 22nd January 2025, Google Pixel 9 price in India starts at Rs. 74,999.

The Moto G45 5G is a budget smartphone from Motorola that is powered by a Snapdragon 6s Gen 3 chipset. It features a large 6.5-inch IPS LCD screen with a 120Hz refresh rate, and the phone is powered by a 5,000mAh battery. 
The design includes a vegan leather finish on the rear panel and flat plastic edges. On the back, there's a raised camera module and the Motorola batwing logo. The Moto G45 5G is available in Brilliant Blue, Brilliant Green, and Viva Magenta colourways.
Running on Android 14 with My UX skin, the Moto G45 5G is a decent performer for daily tasks and light gaming. The 50-megapixel main camera is paired with an 8-megapixel macro camera, while a 16-megapixel camera on the front handles selfies and video calls.
Colours: Brilliant Blue, Brilliant Green, Viva Magenta

Summary:
Xiaomi’s Redmi A4 5G has an attractive design that uses a polycarbonate mid-frame sandwiched between two sheets of glass. Its design is also IP52-rated for dust and water resistance.
The phone has a large display but lacks adequate brightness when viewed outdoors. Viewing angles are also a problem both indoors and outdoors, but the device surprisingly offers Widevine L1 support for full-HD video streaming quality.
Performance is not its strong point. The phone can run apps smoothly but cannot handle heavy 3D games. Camera performance is decent for its price tag when used in daylight but does perform well in low light.
Software works smoothly until you multitask or switch between apps. Its also loaded with tonnes of third-party apps and games. Battery life is average for this price point, and the same can be said about wired charging speeds.

Poco M6 5G mobile was launched on 22nd December 2023. The phone comes with a 90 Hz refresh rate 6.74-inch touchscreen display (HD+) at a pixel density of 260 pixels per inch (ppi). It comes with 4GB, 6GB, 8GB of RAM. The Poco M6 5G runs Android 13 and  is powered by a 5000mAh non-removable battery.  The Poco M6 5G supports proprietary fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Poco M6 5G on the rear packs 50-megapixel camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  a 5-megapixel sensor.The Poco M6 5G runs MIUI 14 is based on Android 13 and packs 64GB, 128GB, 256GB of inbuilt storage that can be expanded via microSD card (up to 1000GB). The Poco M6 5G is a dual-SIM mobile. The Poco M6 5G measures 168.00 x 77.91 x 8.19mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 195.00 grams. It was launched in Galactic Black and  Orion Blue colours. Connectivity options on the Poco M6 5G include Wi-Fi,  GPS, Bluetooth v5.30, and  USB Type-C. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  proximity sensor, and  fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, Poco M6 5G price in India starts at Rs. 7,999.

The Realme GT 6 sports a 6.78-inch curved AMOLED display offers a resolution of 1264x2780 pixels. The triple rear camera setup includes a 50-megapixel primary camera, another 50-megapixel camera, and an 8-megapixel camera. For selfies, there’s a 32-megapixel front camera. Running on Android 14, it’s powered by a 5500mAh battery with SuperVOOC fast charging support. You can choose from 8GB, 12GB, or 16GB of RAM, along with 256GB or 512GB storage options. It runs on Realme UI 5, based on Android 14. Plus, it’s IP65-rated for dust and water protection .

Vivo continues to explore mid-range possibilities with the camera-focused V30 Pro. The phone has a sleek design and decent specifications like a 3D curved-edge display that is bright in broad daylight as well. 
 
Its daylight camera performance is notable, but low-light photography leaves room for improvement. 4K video on both, the rear cameras and the front camera is quite good. Zeiss lens filters are a good addition to the V series and can make the shooting experience a bit more fun.
 
The IP54 rating for dust and water resistance is disappointing for a smartphone in this price range and the latest AI features are also missing on this one. Raw performance is far from the best in class, but the phone offers a smooth software experience with the latest updates.
 
The Vivo V30 Pro could be an option for those prioritising camera capabilities and style in a premium smartphone, but be aware of its limitations.

Moto G05 mobile was launched on 7th January 2025. The phone comes with a 90 Hz refresh rate 6.67-inch touchscreen display offering a resolution of  720x1612 pixels (HD+) at a pixel density of 263 pixels per inch (ppi) and an aspect ratio of 20:9. The display sports Corning Gorilla Glass 3 for protection. It comes with 4GB of RAM. The Moto G05 runs Android 15 and  is powered by a 5200mAh battery.  The Moto G05 supports proprietary fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Moto G05 on the rear packs 50-megapixel camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  an 8-megapixel sensor.The Moto G05 runs Hello UI is based on Android 15 and packs 64GB of inbuilt storage that can be expanded via microSD card (up to 1000GB) with a dedicated slot. The Moto G05 is a dual-SIM mobile. The Moto G05 measures 165.67 x 75.98 x 8.10mm (height x width x thickness)  and weighs 188.80 grams. It was launched in Forest Green and  Plum Red colours. It features an IP52 rating for dust and water protection. Connectivity options on the Moto G05 include Wi-Fi  802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, GPS, Bluetooth v5.40, and  USB Type-C with active 4G on both SIM cards. Sensors on the  phone include  accelerometer,  ambient light sensor,  proximity sensor, and  fingerprint sensor.As of 22nd January 2025, Moto G05 price in India starts at Rs. 6,999.

The Samsung Galaxy F05 runs Android 14 and  is powered by a 5000mAh non-removable battery.  The Samsung Galaxy F05 supports proprietary fast charging. As far as the cameras are concerned, the Samsung Galaxy F05 on the rear packs a dual camera setup featuring a 50-megapixel primary  camera, and  a 2-megapixel  camera. It has a single front camera setup for selfies, featuring  an 8-megapixel sensor.The Samsung Galaxy F05 runs One UI 5 is based on Android 14 and packs 64GB of inbuilt storage that can be expanded via microSD card (up to 1000GB) with a dedicated slot. The Samsung Galaxy F05 is a dual-SIM mobile. It was launched in Twilight Blue colour. Connectivity options on the Samsung Galaxy F05 include Wi-Fi,  GPS, and  USB Type-C.
